article.headline: New Mexico St. 83, Ark.-Pine Bluff 49
article.story: LAS CRUCES, N.M. -- Freshman Christian Kabongo scored 19 points and New Mexico State ended a seven-game losing streak with an 83-49 victory over winless Arkansas-Pine Bluff on Monday night. Hernst Laroche added 16 points and six steals, Bandja Sy had a career-high 15 points and Tyrone Watson finished with 12 points and eight rebounds for the Aggies (3-7). Allen Smith had 10 points to lead the Golden Lions (0-9), who shot 32.8 percent and were 2 of 18 from 3-point range. New Mexico State scored 25 points off 21 Pine Bluff turnovers and outrebounded the Golden Lions 47-25. The Aggies took a 36-19 lead into halftime, opened the second half on a 10-0 run and led by as many as 34.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
